qas.question: What media conglomerate did Comcast begin preliminary talks to buy in 2009?
What was NBC's parent company in 2009?
What ownership stake did Ccomcast get in this deal?
What company was forced to sell its interest in NBCUniversal as part of the purchase deal?
What other cable company was reputed to have an interest in NBCUniversal?
When did CNBC announce Comcast had bought NBCUniversal?
How much of NBCUniversal did CNBC announce Time Warner would own?
How much stock was Vivendi forced to buy?
Who is the CEO of Comcast?
Who reported that Time Warner was placing a bid in November 2009?

context: Media outlets began reporting in late September 2009 that Comcast was in talks to buy <a0_0>NBCUniversal<a0_0/>. Comcast denied the rumors at first, while NBC would not comment on them. However, CNBC itself reported on <b5_0>October 1<b5_0/> that <a1_0>General Electric<a1_0/> was considering spinning NBCUniversal off into a separate company that would merge the NBC television network and its cable properties such as USA Network, Syfy and MSNBC with Comcast's content assets. GE would maintain 49% control of the new company, while Comcast owned <a2_0><b6_0>51%<b6_0/><a2_0/>. <a3_0>Vivendi<a3_0/>, which owns <b7_0>20%<b7_0/>, would have to sell its stake to GE. It was reported that under the current deal with GE that it would happen in November or December. It was also reported that <a4_0>Time Warner<a4_0/> would be interested in placing a bid, until CEO <b8_0>Jeffrey L. Bewkes<b8_0/> directly denied interest, leaving Comcast the sole bidder. On November 1, 2009, <b9_0>The New York Times<b9_0/> reported Comcast had moved closer to a deal to purchase NBCUniversal and that a formal announcement could be made sometime the following week.
